result.execSummary:
The defendant Tylor J Darracott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Tylor J Darracott was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tylor J Darracott is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Tylor J Darracott was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.    May Not have contact with victim.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.  Register as a sex offender for life.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Victim rights compliance.  Victim statements given by Steven R., Nicole R., Samantha J.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 18yrs WSP; initial confinement 3yrs followed by 15yrs of ES.  See conditions.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Defense contests the restitution amount requested by the State.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.  Defense to calculate the credit and submit to DA for approval prior to submitting to court for approval.  Court costs to be taken out of bond.  $800 to be held pending determination of restitution.  Balance of bond may be returned to poster.
Transcript of audio DVD of S.J.
Exhibits 1-6, 8-10 and 13-14 inventoried and stored in Br 1 exhibit room on 08-19-15 - jt

****** *BOND HAS BEEN REVOKED - DEFENDANT TO REMAIN IN CUSTODY UNTIL FINAL DISPOSITION OF CASE **************
*No Contact w/SRJ (dob 7/21/00) or her residence.
948.02(1)(b) -1st Degree Sexual Assault of a Child Under Age 12  2cts.

As to the first count - Jury finds deft - NOT Guilty.
As to the second count - Jury finds deft Guilty of Child Sexual Assault of the 1st degree.
(2) notes from jury
DRAFT NO. 1

Minutes:  Day 4.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Same appearances.  Jury instruction conference held.  Jurors reconvene @ 9:15am.  Defense rests @ 9:16am.  No rebuttal.  Final instructions given to jury.  Closing arguments.  Alternate jurors - Daniel W. & Hoyt H.  Deliberations commence @ 10:28am.  Lunch brought in for the jury.  Verdict reached @ 2:34pm.  Jury finds the deft guilty on count 2 but NOT guilty on count 1.  Jury polled.  Judgment of acquittal on count 1 - count 1 is dismissed.  State moves for judgment on count 2; motion granted.  Bond is revoked; deft taken into custody.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 9/4/15 @ 11am.  Per Court, the bond may be returned to poster.

Minutes:  Day 3.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Same appearances.  Jurors reconvene @ 9:24am.  DVD interview of deft played for the jury.  Testimony continues - Det. Traxler.  Jurors released for lunch @ 12:10pm; instructed to return @ 1:15pm.  Jurors reconvene @ 1:40pm.  Testimony resumes - Det. Traxler.  State's exhibits #1 through #6, #8 through #10, #13, & #14 offered & received.  State rests @ 1:48pm.  Defense case commences.  Testimony taken from Debbie D., Nicole R., Nicholas J., & Dr. White.  Court takes a short recess.  Court reconvenes.  Colliquey conducted with deft as to whether he wishes to testify.  Deft wishes to testify.  Jurors reconvene in courtroom @ 4:33pm.  Testimony continues - deft.  Jurors released for the day @ 5:02pm; instructed to return @ 9am on 7/24/15

Minutes:  Day 2.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Arguments heard on deft's Daubert motion; motion denied.  Jury reconvenes @ 9:45am.  Preliminary instructions given.  Jury sworn.  Opening statement given by ADA Krejcarek.  Defense reserves opening statement.  Testimony commences - Steve R., CAC interview of SJ played for the jury, S.J.  Court takes lunch break during cross examination of SJ.  Jurors released for lunch @ 12:10pm; instructed to return @ 1:30pm.  Jurors reconvene.  Testimony continues - S.J., Julie McGuire, Det. Eric Traxler.  Issues trying to play the DVD interview of the deft for the jury.  Jurors released for the day @ 4:10pm; instructed to return on Thursday, 7/23/15 @ 9am.
Preliminary
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Voir dire commences @ 10:53am.  Jury selected @ 12:54pm.  Unselected jurors released for the day @ 12:55pm - instructed to call the jury phone after 5:30pm tonight.  Selected jurors given a few directions by the Court; jurors released @ 1:05pm and instructed to return @ 9am on 7/21/15.  Court reconvenes @ 2:15pm to commence the Daubert hrg.  Testimony taken from Dr. Lawrence White & Dr. David Thompson.  Court breaks for the day @ 5:25pm.  Attys instructed to return @ 8:40am tomorrow morning to finish motion hrg.
Summary of expert testimony - Filed by ADA J Krejcarek.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Defendant, Tylor J Darracott, appeared with Attorney Aileen G. Henry.  Clerk: PT
Case is not resolved and ludwig hearing is held.  Case remains on for JS on 7/20/15 at 9AM.
#2 - Statement of deft
#1 - Waiver of Const. Rights

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Atty Henry notes for the record that she is w/drawing her Shiffra-Green motion.  Testimony commences on the suppression hrg.  Testimony taken from Det. Eric Traxler.  Exhibits #1 and #2 offered/received.  State rests.  Defense requests the court review the interview DVD.  Suppression mtn taken under advisement.  Arguments heard on deft's other acts motion.  State objects to the "other acts" mtn.  Court's takes "other acts" motion under advisement with a bias towards denying the motion.  Court briefly discusses the Daubert issue with the parties; Daubert hrg will be heard on 7/20/15 @ 1:30pm.  Ludwig hrg will be held on the FPT date.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Defense moves for an adjournment; wishes to have an expert review some discovery.  Since Atty Henry was privately retained, the deft was attempting to raise the funds to pay the expert.  Up until today, Atty Henry was privately retained but now that the deft is indigent - he qualifies for PD presentation.  Atty Henry has now been appointed by the PD's office.  State objects the adjournment request.  Court grants the adjournment request.  Court instructs Atty Henry to contact Dr. Thompson and have him complete his work quickly.  FPT adj to 5/12/15 @ 1:30pm, JS 5/18/15 @ 9am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Henry.  Defense moves for an adjournment; needs time for further investigation.  FPT adj to 4/13/15 @ 4pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Jeremy Chavez (privately retained).  Atty Rufo is allowed to w/draw.  Report has been received from Wis. Forensic Unit.  Report from Dr. Rawski states the deft is competent to proceed.  All parties stipulate to the report.  Deft is found competent to proceed.  Prelim hrg 2/4/15 @ 9:30am
For competency

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Andrea Rufo. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Atty. Rufo raises competency. Time limits for preliminary hearing tolled by court. Court orders competency evaluation under 971.14(2) to be performed by the Milwaukee Forensic Unit, in-patient. Report to be filed in 15 days. Competency hearing on 1-26-15 @ 4:00pm. Bond continued.
Filed by Atty  A Rufo.
